category.title: Installation
category.description: Instructions to install Gazebo on all the plaforms supported: major linux distributions and Mac (windows is still under development).

category.title: Get Started
category.description: Welcome to the Gazebo tutorials! This is a great place to start, especially if you're a new Gazebo user. Each category to the left presents a collection of relevant tutorials.

category.title: Build a Robot
category.description: The following tutorials describe how to build and modify a robot. Included are examples of building a wheeled robot, attaching sensors, attaching actuators, and animating a model.

category.title: Build a World
category.description: These tutorials describe how to create an environment in which robots can be simulated.

category.title: Tools and utilities
category.description: Gazebo ships with many tools and utilities. These tutorials describe the available tools, and how they are used.

category.title: Write a plugin
category.description: Plugins allow you to control models, sensors, world properties, and even the way Gazebo runs. The following tutorials describe how to create and load plugins for various purposes.

category.title: Sensors
category.description: A simulated sensor analyzes the environment and produces a data stream that closely matches the sensor's physical counterpart. These tutorials describe how to use and modify sensors.

category.title: Using Math
category.description: Gazebo has a custom math library. These tutorials describe how to use these math functions.

category.title: User input
category.description: User input can take many forms, including interactions from the graphical interface and hardware devices such as joysticks.

category.title: Connect to Player
category.description: Player is a robot control framework. These tutorials describe how to interface Gazebo and Player.

category.title: Connect to ROS
category.description: ROS is a robot control framework. These tutorials describe how to interface Gazebo and ROS.

category.title: Transport Library
category.description: Communication between the simulation server and client tools uses an advanced message passing system. These tutorials describe how to use Gazebo's message passing infrastructure.

category.title: Physics Library
category.description: A core component of Gazebo are the physics engines. These tutorials describe how to use the physics engines in order to acheive desired behavior.

category.title: Rendering Library
category.description: Gazebo's rendering library is used to generate sensor data and provide user feedback by rendering the environment state.

category.title: Development
category.description: Customizing Gazebo is easy thanks to extensive documentation, tutorials, and online support. These tutorials describe how to contribute your modifications back to Gazebo.

category.title: Scripting (javascript and NodeJs)
category.description: Gazebo scripting interface: NodeJS bindings for the Gazebo simulator.
